  • Quotients \(\mathbb{S}^{3}/(\mathbb{Z}_{2p}\rtimes\mathbb{Z}_{2})\) As Circle Bundles Over \(\mathbb{RP}^{2}\)
  • View page source

Quotients \(\mathbb{S}^{3}/(\mathbb{Z}_{2p}\rtimes\mathbb{Z}_{2})\) As Circle Bundles Over \(\mathbb{RP}^{2}\)ÔÉÅ

We combine the ideas from the two previous examples to construct the non-orientable bundles over \(\mathbb{RP}^{2}\) which also have non-trivial twisted Euler class. One can show that such bundles are classified up to isomorphism by the absolute values of their twisted Euler numbers. In particular, for any even integer \(2p\in \mathbb{Z}\), we define a \(\mathbb{Z}_{2p}\)-action and a \(\mathbb{Z}_{2}\)-action on \(\mathbb{S}^{3}\subset\mathbb{C}^{2}\) by \((w,z)\cdot m := (w,z)\cdot e^{2\pi i\left(\frac{m}{2p}\right)}\) and \((w,z)\cdot (-1) = (-w,\bar{z})\). The resulting quotient space has the structure of a non-orientable circle bundle over \(\mathbb{RP}^{2}\) with twisted Euler number \(\pm p\).

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import circle_bundles as cb

First, generate a sample of \(\mathbb{S}^{3}\) and compute base projections using the Hopf map (see previous examples):

n_samples = 5000
s3_data = cb.sample_sphere(n = n_samples, dim = 3)

base_points = cb.hopf_projection(s3_data)

Construct an open cover of \(\mathbb{RP}^{2}\) using nearly-equidistant landmark points (see reference section):

# --- Construct an open cover of rp2 ---

n_landmarks = 80
rp2_cover = cb.make_rp2_fibonacci_star_cover(base_points, n_pairs = n_landmarks)
rp2_summ = rp2_cover.summarize(plot = True)

Cover And Nerve Summary

  • $n_\text{sets} = 80$, $n_\text{samples} = 5000$

Recorded Simplex Counts:

  • $#(\text{0-simplices}) = 80$

  • $#(\text{1-simplices}) = 237$

  • $#(\text{2-simplices}) = 158$

  • No recorded simplices in dimensions $\ge 3$

Now, choose a quotient metric for the total space and construct a bundle:

p = 3  #CHOOSE: a p-value for the quotient metric

total_metric = cb.S3QuotientMetric(p = 2*p, antipodal = True)

bundle = cb.build_bundle(
    s3_data,
    rp2_cover,
    total_metric = total_metric,
    show=True,
)
\[\begin{split}\displaystyle \begin{aligned}\textbf{Diagnostics} & \\[6pt]\quad \text{Trivialization error} &:\quad \varepsilon_{\text{triv}} := \sup_{(j\,k)\in\mathcal{N}(\mathcal{U})}\sup_{x\in\pi^{-1}(U_j\cap U_k)} d_{\mathbb{C}}(\Omega_{jk}f_k(x),f_j(x)) = 0.351\ \left(\varepsilon_{\text{triv}}^{\text{geo}}=0.112\pi\right)\\[3pt]\quad \text{Mean triv error} &:\quad \bar{\varepsilon}_{\text{triv}} = 0.059\ \left(\bar{\varepsilon}_{\text{triv}}^{\text{geo}}=0.019\pi\right)\\[3pt]\quad \text{Surjectivity defect} &:\quad \delta := \sup_{(i\,j\,k)\in\mathcal{N}(\mathcal{U})}\min_{v\in\{i,j,k\}} d_H\!\left(f_v(\pi^{-1}(U_i\cap U_j\cap U_k)),\mathbb{S}^1\right) = 0.918\\[3pt]\quad \text{Stability ratio} &:\quad \alpha := \varepsilon_{\text{triv}}/(1-\delta) = 4.259\\[3pt]\quad \text{Cocycle error} &:\quad \varepsilon_{\mathrm{coc}} := \sup_{(i\,j\,k)\in\mathcal{N}(\mathcal{U})}\left\|\Omega_{ij}\Omega_{jk}\Omega_{ki}-I\right\|_F = 0.317\\[3pt]\quad \text{Euler rounding dist.} &:\quad d_\infty(\delta_\omega\theta,\tilde{e}) = 0.036\\[14pt]\textbf{Characteristic Classes} & \\[6pt]\quad \text{Stiefel--Whitney} &:\quad w_1 \neq 0\ (\text{non-orientable})\\[3pt]\quad \text{(twisted) Euler number} &:\quad \pm 3\end{aligned}\end{split}\]
